title: How to Make Laab Moo

steps.headline: Squeeze juice from 1/3 of a lime onto the ground pork.
steps.description: Mix well and let it marinate on the side for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Heat 2 tablespoons of water in a pot over high heat.
steps.description: Add the marinated pork and stir. The pork will stick to the pan at first, but then the juice will come out and the meat will loosen from the bottom. Keep stirring until the pork is well done.

steps.headline: Place the pork in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the fish sauce, green onion, shallot, cilantro, the rest of the lime juice, chilli, and almost all of the toasted rice to the bowl. Save some toasted rice on the side for the garnish.

steps.headline: Mix well and taste.
steps.description: It should be a little hot, as you should be able to taste the tartness from the lime juice and fish sauce. Season the mixture with extra lime juice or fish sauce if needed.

steps.headline: Put the mixed ingredients in a serving bowl.
Garnish with spearmint and the remaining toasted rice on top.
Serve the dish with vegetables, such as green beans, cabbage, and lettuce.

text: Squeeze juice from 1/3 of a lime onto the ground pork. Mix well and let it marinate on the side for a few minutes. Heat 2 tablespoons of water in a pot over high heat. Add the marinated pork and stir. The pork will stick to the pan at first, but then the juice will come out and the meat will loosen from the bottom. Keep stirring until the pork is well done. Place the pork in a large mixing bowl. Add the fish sauce, green onion, shallot, cilantro, the rest of the lime juice, chilli, and almost all of the toasted rice to the bowl. Save some toasted rice on the side for the garnish. Mix well and taste. It should be a little hot, as you should be able to taste the tartness from the lime juice and fish sauce. Season the mixture with extra lime juice or fish sauce if needed. Put the mixed ingredients in a serving bowl.  Garnish with spearmint and the remaining toasted rice on top.  Serve the dish with vegetables, such as green beans, cabbage, and lettuce.
